intro: Dicliptera ovata, commonly known as the ovalleaf dicliptera, is a flowering plant species native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, two-lipped flowers. It is often found in open grasslands and along riverbanks, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens in warmer climates.
